tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE climate_disasters (
  disaster_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  disaster_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  date_occurred DATE NOT NULL,
  severity INTEGER,
  description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE hurricanes (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name TEXT,
  location TEXT,
  intensity INT,
  date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE wildfires (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name TEXT,
  location TEXT,
  area_affected FLOAT,
  date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE hurricanes (
  hurricane_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(100),
  location VARCHAR(100),
  severity ENUM('low', 'medium', 'high'),
  year INT
);

CREATE TABLE floods (
  flood_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location VARCHAR(100),
  severity ENUM('low', 'medium', 'high'),
  affected_area DECIMAL(10, 2),
  damage_cost DECIMAL(20, 2)
);

CREATE TABLE wildfires (
  wildfire_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location VARCHAR(100),
  acreage DECIMAL(10, 2),
  containment_status ENUM('controlled', 'uncontrolled'),
  start_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE hurricanes (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    category INT,
    date DATE,
    affected_area VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE floods (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    severity INT,
    date DATE,
    affected_population INT
);

CREATE TABLE wildfires (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    acres_burned INT,
    date DATE,
    containment_status VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE disaster_response (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    disaster_id INT,
    disaster_type VARCHAR(50),
    response_team VARCHAR(255),
    response_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE damage_assessment (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    disaster_id INT,
    type_of_damage VARCHAR(50),
    assessment_date DATE,
    assessment_notes TEXT
);
